meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in number or spread widely.
meanings.sent1: The flowers proliferated in the garden, filling it with color.
meanings.sent2: The virus proliferated throughout the community, affecting many people.
meanings.sent3: The cookies in the jar seemed to have proliferated overnight!
meanings.sent4: Gossip proliferated through the school like wildfire, spreading quickly.
meanings.sent5: The weeds in the yard proliferated so fast, it was hard to keep up with them.

meanings.sent1: The bacteria proliferated in the warm environment of the petri dish.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit population proliferated in the field, causing concern for farmers.
meanings.sent3: The toys in the playroom seemed to have proliferated on their own!
meanings.sent4: Laughter proliferated in the room, creating a joyful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The rumors about the celebrity proliferated online, spreading like wildfire.
